intro: Bothriocline papuana, commonly known as the Papuan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
